title: Arrested crypto boss hugs parents as he is denied bail over 'one of biggest financial frauds in US history'
description: Former cryptocurrency exchange boss Sam Bankman-Fried hugged his parents after being denied bail on charges relating to "one of the biggest financial frauds in American history".

title: Joe Biden signs law to protect same-sex marriages striking a 'blow against hate'
description: Joe Biden has signed legislation protecting same-sex marriages and declared the "law and the love it defends strike a blow against hate in all its forms".

title: Bali bombmaker apologises for 2002 attack that killed 202 people
description: An Indonesian bombmaker has apologised to victims' families for making the explosives used in the 2002 Bali bombings.

title: World Cup 2022: Live updates as Argentina take on Croatia for place in Sunday's final
Eight convicted over Nice truck attack that killed 86 people in 2016
description: Eight people have been convicted for their role in a truck attack more than six years ago by an Islamic State sympathiser that killed 86 people celebrating Bastille Day in Nice.

title: Argentina through to World Cup final after beating Croatia 3-0
description: Argentina are through to the World Cup final after beating Croatia.

title: Breakthrough nuclear fusion experiment could 'revolutionise the world' with clean energy
description: US scientists have carried out the first ever nuclear fusion experiment to achieve a net energy gain, paving the way for a "clean energy source that could revolutionise the world".

title: Flight MH370 debris suggests pilot lowered plane's landing gear and crashed deliberately
description: A newly discovered piece of debris from flight MH370 suggests the pilot lowered the plane's landing gear just before it plunged into the ocean, supporting the theory that the aircraft was crashed deliberately.

title: Ukraine War Diaries: From a city under siege, a very Ukrainian Christmas story
description: Ilyas Verdiev's Kyiv apartment is usually at fever pitch this time of year.

title: EU vice-president stripped of role amid Qatar corruption scandal
description: The European Parliament has stripped a Greek MEP of her role as one of the body's vice presidents over allegations that Qatar had bribed her to influence decision-making.

title: Teen shot in head by Greek police after 'stealing €20 of petrol' dies in hospital
description: A teenager shot in the head by police after allegedly driving off without paying for €20 of petrol has died.

title: Indian and Chinese forces clash on disputed Himalayan border
description: Indian and Chinese forces have clashed along their disputed border - the first such incident between the two nuclear powers since deadly confrontations in 2020.

title: Bolsonaro supporters attack police headquarters in Brazil's capital
description: Police fired stun grenades and tear gas to disperse supporters of far-right Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro after they attempted to invade the federal police headquarters in the capital Brasilia.

title: Future generations banned from ever being able to buy tobacco in New Zealand
description: New Zealand has passed one of the world's toughest anti-smoking laws that will gradually ban more and more people from ever being able to buy tobacco.

title: Former crypto exchange boss charged with defrauding investors
description: The former boss of one of the world's biggest cryptocurrency exchanges has been charged with defrauding investors out of $1.8bn (£1.5bn).

title: 'I've had a bad month': How FTX founder went from star-studded £21bn empire to being charged
K-pop star Jin from supergroup BTS begins military service
description: Jin, the oldest member of K-pop supergroup BTS, has started his 18 months of mandatory military service at a South Korean boot camp.

title: New Zealand's PM caught calling rival politician a rude name
description: New Zealand's prime minister has been caught calling a rival politician an "arrogant p***k" during a parliamentary debate.

title: Six dead - including two police officers killed 'execution-style' - at remote Australian property
description: Six people, including two police officers, have been killed in a gunfight at a remote home in Australia's Queensland state.
